intro: Cassytha melantha, commonly known as the thread vine or slender cassytha, is a climbing herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems that often root at the nodes. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are usually ovate to elliptical in shape. It produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, followed by berries that are typically yellow or red when mature. Cassytha melantha is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
